result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcella Z Benson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marcella Z Benson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marcella Z Benson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcella Z Benson

records.addlTxt: for pymt of Atty Fees filed by Atty T Anderson totalling $486.15. jaf         To SRN
for pymt of Atty Fees filed by Atty T Anderson. jaf

10:04 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Marcella Z Benson in court.  Attorney Timothy Dale Anderson in court for Marcella Z Benson.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CM356 & 22TR1539.  ADA Ellenwood recites joint recommendation to an AMENDED Ct 1 in criminal matter.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to AMENDED Ct 1- Disorderly Conduct 947.01 in 22CM356 and Ct 1 in 22TR1539. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of AMENDED Ct 1 in 22CM356 and Ct 1 in 22TR1539.  On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 22CM356. Sentencing arguments.  Court QUASHES WARRANT for Atty Fees.  Court questions DE on payments and when she can make payment.  DE to make $100 payment by end of next week Friday, if no payment DE will have warrant issued. Court suspends Atty Fee payments until December. 


Court Orders: 22TR1539

F/F: $515.50- Apply money on file.

- Court Costs: $243     
- DNA Surcharge: $200
Balance to be added to current Atty payment plan.
